result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick MA Parker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $47.83 is paid in full from cash bond previously posted. The 10% surcharge in the amount of $4.78 is also paid in full.
Costs are paid in full from cash bond previously posted.  The remaining balance of the cash bond has been refunded to the Poster.
Defendant to obtain a GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.
Defendant to comply with any further terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.    DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

records.addlTxt: 2:03 pm case called. Defendant Derrick MA Parker in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Derrick MA Parker in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation Order and Warrant received by both counsel. No corrections or additions. Chapter 950 compliance. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zamzow. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: EACH COUNT-6 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 83 days served. Concurrent to each other but consecutive to any other sentence. Costs & restitution have been paid in full. Appeal Rights Given.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Derrick MA Parker
Current: 112 South Court Street, Box 500, c/o Monroe Co Jail, Sparta, WI 54656 United States  (Effective: 03-03-2017)
Prior: 23464 Highway 21, Tomah, WI 54660
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 31, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Case Called @ 3:14 PM: Defendant Derrick MA Parker in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jt Agreement on resolution recited by DA. Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1: NC  Plea Ct 3: NC   Court accepts pleas and enters JOC. Ct 2 and 4 DRI with 16TR-463 and 16TR-464 also DRI.  Statement by Def: None offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution.  Ct 1 S/W - 2 yrs.  Conditions:  Pay Rest of $47.83 PIF from bond posted (Paid to Officer Directly by COC)  - balance of bond to be applied to financial obligations; any other terms as deemed appropriate by Supervising Agent; Complete HSED or GED during pendency of probation term; Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Ct 3:  S/W - 2 yrs probation - concurrent to Ct 1 - same terms  as to Ct 1 without Restitution.  Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:31 PM:  Defendant Derrick MA Parker in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.  Defendant Derrick MA Parker in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts voluntary waiver of 10 day time limit for preliminary hearing.   Def states full bond was posted last week.  Jurisdiction coordination will be occurring.  SPD states Def awaits being picked up to address other county warrants.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 03:50 pm.

Must provide an updated adress to the Clerk of Court and maintain a current address with the Clerk of Court as well.  The cash bond currently on file with the Waushara Co Jail in the amount of $1300.00 to be applied to the cash bond ordered with an additional $3700.00 to be posted prior to release.

Case Called @ 1:00 PM: Defendant Derrick MA Parker in court, appearing pro se, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def had spoken with SPD and is going to try and hire is own counsel.  De has counsel in Juneau and Monroe Counties - SPD counsel appointed.  Def again requests to speak with SPD again for counsel.  Def is again referred to SPD for eligibility.  ADA argues as to bond request - feels cash bond would be appropriate.  Statement as to bond by Def - requests a possible Signature Bond to be able to take care of matters in Monroe.  The Court:    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Finds risk of flight is paramount.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
